newsitem.title: GERMANY: RWE sees continuation of 9-mo profit growth.
newsitem.headline: RWE sees continuation of 9-mo profit growth.

text.p: Germany's RWE AG said on Friday it expected a 6.8 percent rise in group net profit in the first nine months of its 1996/97 financial year to continue for the full year, which ends on June 30.
In the nine months ended March 31 the diversified electricity utility increased its group net profit to 878 million marks from 822 million marks in the year-earlier period.
Group sales rose 7.8 percent to 52.93 billion marks from 49.1 billion, the company said.
RWE said the rise in nine-month earnings stemmed mainly from its engineering and plant construction activities.
Start-up costs for its telecommunications business had risen significantly, as expected, the company said.
